TopicTitle: [AnyOS] KSP Mod Admin v2 - Mod install with a few clicks

Articles.Content:
I've had the same problems previously but as everything seemed to work, i didn't give it much thought. However it now appears not all required mods are transferred. (That was a very expensive realisation as a very large spacestation i've been vanished due to a missing part.

I won't be using 1.2.4 anymore. If i can, i will go back to a previous version (or await 1.2.5)

Ouch im sorry about that! I hope you have a backup!!

1.2.5 will come in about 6-7 hours (im on work right now)

I have fixed the problems with the destination selection now.

1.2.5 is almost out, just one more question ...

@TheCardinal: What do you mean with "not all required mods are transfered"?

Sorry for the last 2 buggy versions. The impact of code refractoring was quiet heavy

But the good news is -> refractoring is done and this version is stabil again.

Changes:

- Another "loading of older configs" bug fixed.

- Crash during destination selection fixed. -> Thanks to "MrHanMan" & "TheCardinal"!

- Select destination dialog - filter settings changed when selected node is a file.

- AutoCheck of nodes that dont have a destination - fixed.

- Direct download now works again.

- Backuppath selection works again.

- Recover of free choosen paths to backup works again.

Upcoming:

- Scann of the GameData folder for installed mods that aren't in the mod selection.

- Zip function for mods where the zip file is missing.

- Autobackup of the save folder in configurable intervals.

- ...

Edited July 11, 2013 by MacTee
How do we get it to uninstall a mod?

How do we get it to uninstall a mod?

Uncheck (unhook) the mod and press "All Mods" (will uninstall the mod)

or

uncheck the mod, select it (mark it by clicking the mod name) and press "Selected Mod" (will uninstall the mod)

or

select the mod and press "Remove" (will uninstall the mod and removes it from the selection).

Hi cyone,

i will answer your question in the german forum thread of KSP Mod Admin and a translation of his question/problem will be coming soon.

Thanks, I'll be looking into that link.

TL;DT (Too long, didn't translate):

I had problems with KSPMA when installing a second KSP (one for .20, one for .21), as it seems to store it's saved stuff (KSP-path and other things) somewhere else... And that causes some problems in functionality and convenience.

The new version fixes the problem that the mod selection does't clear when the KSP install path was chenged.

Now you can manage more KSP installations with one KSP Mod Admin just by changing the KSP install path.

Thanks to cy-one!!

The next version will provide a simple manager for different KSP installations.

Stay tuned for 1.3.0 ...

Hey,

works so far But I would have another wish for 1.3.0

Choosing the installation folder is currently kind of a pain in the ass, as you have chosen the most inconvenient dialog possible.

I hate this "tree-selection-dialog" with fiery passion (not just in KSPMA). Reason is, you can't copy/paste the directory and HAVE to navigate to it.

I would wish that at least the field where the current path is displayed wouldn't be read-only, so you can quickly paste the new path into there.

Maybe that gets obsolete with 1.3.0, I don't know. Either way I hope you don't continue to make the user force to navigate through the path like that

Thanks btw, for the fast fix \o/

Hu? Please elaborate, I'm currently a bit lost on how to D&D a directory.

Let me clear this up.

In 1.3.0 ther will be a KSP install path manager (or KSPIPMA lol) with a treeview where you can drag and drop a folder from a explorer window.

This folder will be added to the list of known KSP install folders (the treeview).

The textbox where currently the KSP Path is displayed will be changed to a drop down menu where you can select between the known KSP install folder. In this way you can change the selected KSP Installation with just one click.

While I would still prefer something where one can copy a path into, your solution sounds reasonable enough

Btw, support for the DEL-key in the Mods-window would be appreciated

PS: I hope I don't annoy you with all those "please do that, this would be nice, and those would be appreciated"-stuff :/

Btw, support for the DEL-key in the Mods-window would be appreciated

PS: I hope I don't annoy you with all those "please do that, this would be nice, and those would be appreciated"-stuff :/

I will think about a solution for the copy and past, maybe when the KSPIPMA (lol again) is active you can press ctrl + v and i check the clipboard information then.

The Del-Key is on my todo list for quiet a long time now maybe its time to get rid of it

... I have been using KSPModAdmin v1.2.6 for 2 days now and for some reason, today, it has started not loading the UI. I have an icon on the task bar that I can hover over and get a nice preview of the UI and what it should look like when maximized, ...

my first guess is that the saving of the last window position has a bug. (did you use 2 screens, or 2 different screens)?

try the following:

- open the cfg file c:\programdata\kspmodadmin\kspmodadmin\1.2.6.0\KSPModAdmin.cfg

- change the position parameter (<Position x="???" y="???" />) to <Position x="0" y="0" />.

- start KSP Mod Admin
I had the same problem, and I DO use 2 different screens (22" portrait, 27" landscape).

I have identified the problem which causes the KSPMA to starts without displaying the GUI.

This happens when you closes the KSPMA when its minimized (e.g. with right on Taskbar icon and close window when KSPMA is minimized).

To get the GUI back you have to do the following:

- open the cfg file c:\programdata\kspmodadmin\kspmodadmin\1.2.6.0\KSP ModAdmin.cfg

- change the position parameter (<Position x="???" y="???" />) to <Position x="0" y="0" />.

- start KSP Mod Admin again.

The bug will be fixed in the next version.
